alert.note: Alert for Pembina (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 9:54AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .The crest on the mainstem Red has passed through Oslo and is now en route to Drayton. Drayton should crest within the next few days with Pembina following later this weekend or early next week. Minor flooding continues for most points downstream of Fargo/Moorhead with the exception being moderate flooding at Oslo. Minor flooding continues on the Two Rivers River at Hallock. All other tributaries are below action stage with the exception of the Maple River at Mapleton which may continue to see some minor fluctuations above action stage. Portions of the far southern basin and into west central Minnesota received a fair amount of precipitation with the latest system to impact the area. However, with most of this precipitation falling as snow, immediate impacts to river levels is not expected. Lastly, today`s river forecasts do incorporate the precipitation that has occurred and any lingering precipitation with this system. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Pembina. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 39.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 38.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 40.5 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
